channel.title: BBC News | News Front Page | World Edition
channel.description: Visit BBC News for up-to-the-minute news, breaking news, video, audio and feature stories. BBC News provides trusted World and UK news as well as local and regional perspectives. Also entertainment, business, science, technology and health news.
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse

item.title: Serbia captures fugitive Karadzic
item.description: Bosnian Serb war crimes suspect Radovan Karadzic, one of the world's most wanted men, is captured in Serbia.

item.title: Zimbabwe leaders agree talks pact
item.description: Zimbabwe's president and opposition leader sign an agreement to hold talks on the country's political crisis.

item.title: Bin Laden's driver denies charges
item.description: A former driver of Osama Bin Laden pleads not guilty at the first war crimes trial to be held in Guantanamo Bay.

item.title: McCanns vow to continue searching
item.description: The parents of Madeleine McCann insist they "will never give up" on her, despite the case being shelved by Portuguese officials.

item.title: France backs constitution reform
item.description: French lawmakers back President Sarkozy's plans to rewrite the country's constitution - in a razor-edge vote.

item.title: Kosovo moves to issue passports
item.description: Kosovo begins accepting applications for passports, five months after declaring independence from Serbia.

item.title: Two dead in US B-52 bomber crash
item.description: The US Air Force says two bodies have been recovered from a B-52 bomber, which crashed into the Pacific off the coast of Guam.

item.title: Burma aid effort 'requires $1bn'
item.description: Relief and reconstruction work in Burma after Cyclone Nargis will cost at least $1bn, say the UN and regional body Asean.

item.title: Jackson 'malfunction' fine axed
item.description: US judges throw out a $550,000 fine against CBS for showing Janet Jackson's 2004 Super Bowl "wardrobe malfunction".

item.title: How holidaymakers managed to catch the wrong plane
item.description: A family realise they are on the wrong plane only when the air hostess says "welcome to Turkey".

item.title: England crash to 10-wicket defeat
item.description: South Africa seal a 10-wicket win over England on the fourth day at Headingley to take a 1-0 lead into the final two Tests.

item.title: Ferguson warns Ronaldo over Real
item.description: Sir Alex Ferguson warns Cristiano Ronaldo that moving to Real Madrid would be the 'worst thing' for his career.

item.title: Living in fear
item.description: Tanzania's albinos are still targeted by witch doctors

item.title: Torch relay
item.description: The flame arrives in Qufu, birthplace of Confucius

item.title: Against the odds
item.description: Hungarian with Olympic judo dreams battles tragedy

item.title: Getting drier?
item.description: World's wettest town hit by changing weather

item.title: Jurassic past
item.description: Ancient footprints put Yemeni village on the map

item.title: Case closed
item.description: Portuguese police shelve missing British child inquiry

item.title: AU rejects Bashir Darfur charges
item.description: The African Union calls for war crimes accusations against Sudan's president to be dropped.

item.title: Obama meets Iraqi PM in Baghdad
item.description: US Democratic presidential hopeful Barack Obama meets the Iraqi prime minister on his first visit to Baghdad.

item.title: Bali bombers 'to die by September'
item.description: Three militants behind the bloody 2002 bombings in Bali could be executed by early September, Indonesia says.

item.title: Sarkozy denies pressurising Irish
item.description: France's President Sarkozy plays down Lisbon Treaty tensions in Dublin, saying he is working on a "solution" with Irish leaders.

item.title: Brown issues Iran nuclear warning
item.description: UK Prime Minister Gordon Brown warns Iran over its nuclear programme as he addresses Israel's parliament.

item.title: Indian MPs hold confidence debate
item.description: India's parliament holds a two-day debate ahead of a vote of confidence over a controversial nuclear deal with the US.

item.title: Prisoners 'sleeping in toilets'
item.description: Some prisoners are living and sleeping in toilets because of increased overcrowding, a report says.

item.title: Apple sees profits beat forecast
item.description: US technology giant Apple sees profits beat forecasts, but warns of slower earnings ahead.

item.title: Drug for deadly prostate cancer
item.description: Scientists say a drug to treat aggressive prostate cancer may be the most significant advance in the field for 70 years.

item.title: Clean deadline call on coal power
item.description: The government should set a deadline for coal power stations to "clean up" or close, a parliamentary committee says.

item.title: Mercury shortlist to be announced
item.description: The 12 British and Irish acts which feature on this year's Mercury Prize shortlist will be announced later.

item.title: Oyster card hack to be published
item.description: A Dutch judge rules that details of how to copy Oyster cards can be published.

item.title: Your say
item.description: What do you want the world to talk about?
